intro: Janusia hexandra, commonly known as the narrow-leafed dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, thriving in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture, while the flowers are yellow and resemble those of the common dandelion. Janusia hexandra is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional African medicine.
